headline.main: AFFAIRS IN ENGLAND.; The Emperor's Letter Garibaldi Parliamentary Intelligence Miscellaneous News and Gossip.

docs.lead_paragraph: The chief topic here is the singular letter which the Emperor has written to his Ambassador at London. The extreme peace party, of course, receive it with acclamation. By Englishmen generally it is thought to be too civil by half, undignified, somewhat false, and very suspicious. On the principle of qui s'excuse s'exeuse, the letter is open to criticism, and the motives of the writer to doubt.

headline.main: NEW PUBLICATIONS.; REPUBLICAN CAMPAIGN TEXT-BOOK, for the Year 1860. By WM. HENRY FRY. NEW-YORK: A.H. BUERDICK, NO. 145 Nassau-street.

docs.snippet: The fine bark Eliza Barss starts to-day for New-York, and I hasten to send you all the news that I have collected.
docs.lead_paragraph: The fine bark Eliza Barss starts to-day for New-York, and I hasten to send you all the news that I have collected.

docs.snippet: The R.M. steamship Edinburgh, from Liverpool on the 1st inst. and Queenstown on the 2d, arrived at this port last night. Her news is mostly anticipated by the arrival of the Adriatic, which left Southampton on the 1st; but we have one day later...
docs.lead_paragraph: The R.M. steamship Edinburgh, from Liverpool on the 1st inst. and Queenstown on the 2d, arrived at this port last night. Her news is mostly anticipated by the arrival of the Adriatic, which left Southampton on the 1st; but we have one day later advices telegraphed vid Queenstown.

headline.main: SENATOR SEWARD IN NEW-ENGLAND.; Reception at Bangor, Me., and Boston, Mass. THE BOSTON RECEPTION.

docs.lead_paragraph: Senator SEWARD arrived at Bangor, Me., on Saturday, in the midst of a heavy shower. His arrival was quite unexpected. The Republicans, however, mustered pretty strongly. Some 1,500 or 2,000 people assembled at the hotel, and he was welcomed by the Mayor while the band played "Hall to the Chief," and afterwards the commander of the WideAwake Club stepped forward and said:

docs.snippet: The fate of that eccentric but determined man, Dr. VOGEL, whose reputation as a learned traveler is world-wide, is as yet uncertain. The Duke of SAKE-COBURG has decided to send an expedition to Africa in search of him, or of information concerning...
docs.lead_paragraph: The fate of that eccentric but determined man, Dr. VOGEL, whose reputation as a learned traveler is world-wide, is as yet uncertain. The Duke of SAKE-COBURG has decided to send an expedition to Africa in search of him, or of information concerning his disappearance.

docs.snippet: For many a long year we have enjoyed the enthusiasm of affection and the intensity of admiration manifested by our solid brethren of Boston town toward their Common. No malls can compare, say they, with our Common's malls, no grass is so green ...

headline.main: A DAY IN THE CENTRAL PARK.; The Place, its Attractions and its Visitors.

docs.lead_paragraph: For many a long year we have enjoyed the enthusiasm of affection and the intensity of admiration manifested by our solid brethren of Boston town toward their Common. No malls can compare, say they, with our Common's malls, no grass is so green ...
